reviews.text: Update your hours.  Hours indicate 1am on google and in your window. Came a long way to be disappointed.

High quality and fresh fish. Very very good. I had the crab quesadilla which was delicious!!!

I also had the lobster taco and this disappointed me a little in the taste there was not quite a pezazzz if you know what I mean. But still all the ingredients were top top quality so it‚Äôs still a five for me!

Service was great. Thank you!
Nasty food and nasty man who manages the restaurant

Posto incredibile dove mangiare tipico messicano in Brooklyn, personale super disponibile e gentile.
Tappa fissa se si passa di qui

Amazing octopus taco. The service was fast and very welcoming.
To add to that, the decor was beautiful!
Will come back again!
Love this place. The food was good, and the service was great. Good vibes to enjoy it with friends. Would love to come again.
Great food, great service, will be back!

Delicious seafood options in an already dense and competitive stretch of food options. The pilin in particular is worth going out of your way for - crispy plantain, fresh seafood, and a crunchy cabbage and carrot slaw. It‚Äôs a nearly perfect bite of food!
great shrimp tacos!
This place is incredible. Can‚Äôt go wrong with any items, but I got the shrimp quesadilla and it was PERFECT. Great environment and the staff was very personal. Definitely coming back!
Best ceviche and shrimp cocktail experience ever
The tortillas were homemade and so tasty. The service was as warm as it gets. We sat outside on a beautiful summer night.  Five stars all around!
Incredible food and genuinely sweet staff. House made tortillas made for the perfect tostada. Can‚Äôt wait to come back!

We are from PA retired military.
Place was as clean as a Friday inspection. Bathroom excellent.
Glasses clean.
Mezacal drink menu awesome.
Food choice marvelous.
Started with Crab Empanda delicious.

Shrimp in a small iron skillet with excellent dipping bread and homemade chips.

Had the whole red snapper flash fried. It was tender moist and came off the skeleton easily.
It was served with a salad and squid ink rice that was perfectly prepared.

Had the flan dessert.
Nice place üëå üëç üëè
This place is amazing... It's a secret gem üíé! Food and Drinks are delicious!

Delicious tacos and empanadas.
Flan de coco over the top.
Muy rico lo recomiendo tragos comida  exelente el servicio  de angy ni se diga super amigables

Food excellent
Service amazing, very professional

Place for dates or special occasions
It's not a casual fast place.

Food took too long to arrive

This review was 2 years ago

Owner amazing personality ‚ú®Ô∏è thanks Roger üòä

Now review on August 25 2025

What a place.... it's a shame that it's not as busy as should be.... food it's better than I remember
Service always amazing üëè
Always bringing family here it's a treat...
I was homesick today, feeling like I wanted a piece of home and food! Warmth, kindness and delicious food is all in one place. We def coming back soon, thank you for the delicious coconut flan!
The food was sooo great, mayne the best taco‚Ä¶. And great drinks too! Super great place!
I love love the experience we had at The King of Fish! The food is Amazing. The people are beautiful. The king of fish reeled us in :).. definetly a nice CATCH!
La comida super rica buen sabor , buena m√∫sica y el personal muy amable üòä sin duda de mis lugares favoritos para comer
Muy buen servicio
This place is absolutely amazing, Every item in the menu we tried was delicious, Definitely will be returning!!

La comida aqu√≠ es muyyy sabrosa. We got micheladas; tacos (pescado & pulpo); and the shrimp al mojo de ajo üò§ sooo freaking good. They need more light at night on the patio imma be honest, but maybe u have better vision than me chile ü´£

If you love high quality food, you have to try this spot! The ingredients are top notch and you can really taste the difference. The tortillas are super unique, the cocktails are amazing (especially the mezcal ones, my favorite spirit), and the vibe is beautiful with great music. Service is 10/10. Highly recommend! üôåüèª

We came in on a slow rainy day and this place did not disappoint! The food was amazing and you gotta get the quesadilla and guacamole.

Roger was an amazing host and was so kind and attentive!
Fish taco and shrimp taco is superb.   Salsa sauce is very tasty.   Roger, the owner is super nice to go across the street in the rain to order vegetarian taco for us.  Everything is super good.
Excelente muy buen servicio y la comida deliciosa

King of Fish is probably fun as a bar but as a restaurant it‚Äôs pretty mid. It clearly has had a lot of money put into the interior design and merchandising and it has an interesting menu, so I was expecting more, as I had a decent time here a few years ago.

The bar area looks really nice but then there‚Äôs all this random AirBnb ‚Äúlive laugh love‚Äù style art just randomly applied all over the walls of the place. The audio was a YouTube music video playlist blasting on the TV and speakers at an obnoxious volume too loud to hear anyone speaking. There was no air conditioning on a hot day, just fans pointing at the ceiling; we had to go outside because it was unbearable.

The food was average and the service bad. A big sign out front advertised oysters and was why I stopped in, but nope no Oysters today. Our drinks sat on the bar for ten minutes before we asked about them and then they were brought over. When they finally made it over, they tasted fine, though they weren‚Äôt anything to write home about. The lobster roll, shrimp, and seafood empanadas we ordered were fine, we enjoyed them, and the presentation was good, but it wasn‚Äôt anything special. The seafood in them didn‚Äôt feel fresh and seemed likely frozen, Costco level. The premium pricing for the average food was pretty frustrating. Service was disjointed: drinks took forever and it took multiple requests to get napkins and forks.

The payment experience was terrible: when you get the bill, they give you a big laminated card that says they don‚Äôt take cards, just Zelle and cash. The Zelle goes to the owners personal account, possibly to avoid paying taxes on revenue, the ATM charges a $3 fee like it‚Äôs a bank, and regardless of how you pay, they add a 2.59% ‚Äúservice fee‚Äù like they‚Äôre UberEats or something. If you have a restaurant built out like this and charging this much money for average food, you need to take card and not do this penny-pinching small business owner stuff. This place is a great example that not every small business is worth supporting.
Food was so fresh and so flavorful. We wanted authentic Mexican seafood and Roger (the sweet owner) more than delivered.
This was fantastic! We had michelada, ceviche, gambas al ajillo, agachile, king of fish, all of it was amazing

Our first time here, and we loved it! I had the habanero lime shrimp platter, and my wife had the whole fried red snapper. The food was delicious, and the service was fast and friendly. My wife loved her classic margarita as well. Roger took great care of us, Roger that!
One of my favorite restaurants in NYC. Food is amazing, a seafood lover's delight. Margaritas are delicious. The atmosphere is casual and a little campy. Roger is super hospitable. Love it.
As good as restaurants get. Atmosphere is what you‚Äôd expect at a seafood place. Perfect all round and friendly staff.
Such a great experience! Super fresh fish and handmade tortillas were amazing!

I really liked the place ‚Äî very clean, great drinks, and a very relaxing atmosphere.
If they had more variety in the music, it would be amazing.
But for a first visit, I really enjoyed it.
Honestly a 5 out of 5. AMAZING jazz music playing, food is incredible & the staff is amazing as well! Definitely give this place a try, you will not regret it.
Best customer service food is great drinks are great ..THE CRACK !!

A great place to grab drink and a quick bite! While also having a great menu should you want a full meal, grab some calamari to start and a wide variety of seafood tacos to order from, all at a reasonable price. The atmosphere is very lively with either afrobeats or mexican regional music playing  consistently as well as some pop hits in between.

Caution: Beware as they only take cash and can‚Äôt process credit or debit card payments at the time of review! This isn‚Äôt apparent and may catch you off guard, very unfortunate as credit and debit card POS are a standard for all other restaurants in the area.
Fantastic
Rocio muy amable, muy buena atenci√≥n. Toda la comida deliciosa. Recomendado 100%
Great food and drinks! We will definitely be back. The only thing is the air conditioner HVAC kept dripping on us.
Great service üëè love it and the patio is perfect for a white party ü•≥
Tuna tostada delicious
Great place to grab a drink. Amazing vibe and the outfits are super cute üòç

So good!! Ordered the chips & guac, fish taco, and shrimp taco. Loved the crispy chips and and citrusy guacamole! Tacos were amazing, loved that the tortillas were all home made and the flavors of the fish & shrimp were delicious. You can tell everything is fresh and home made. The owner was so nice too! I‚Äôll definitely be back again.
This place it's  amazing and food its really good.
Food was delicious, service was delightful, wall placks were inspiring

Hole in the wall! Great vibe.. there are two section. The indoors in dark and vibey with great music and the outdoors is light airy a with cute decorations. Staff is super super nice and accommodating. We were sat in 5 mins!

The food was fantastic! Seafood was super fresh. We got calamari mixed plate for an app and the guac. Both were delicious and fresh! Highly recommend. The platter is a steal!!!

Amazing food, service and ambience! We had an amazing night here. 4 kids and 3 adults with a last minute reservation and the staff were so accommodating and friendly.

The drink menu has an impressive selection of mezcal which is my absolute favorite. 2 pages of mezcal drinks! All fresh house made ingredients.

The food was also just as amazing. We tried the garlic butter shrimp, guacamole and agua chile shrimp. All were yummy and fresh with the right amount of spice.

I tried the fish and lobster tacos. Both were food dance inducing! The homemade corn tortillas were hearty and held up to the generous fillings.

I also tried the crab pilon which was a taco served on a fried plantain. That was super yummy too!

I‚Äôm leaving here stuffed and happy!! Super cute spot for a date or family night out!

Ps- they were playing awesome music too!!

It‚Äôs a nice hidden gem in the heart of sunset. We come here all the time for the amazing variety of beer drafts but today we were hungry and tried the food for the first time. It did not disappoint! I had three different selection of their tacos and each taco was so flavorful and delicious. I would recommend giving this spot a try if you‚Äôre looking for something lowkey and want to try something different from the ordinary. Our server was super nice and attentive. Definitely coming back again to try the rest of the menu. :)

I cannot say how much I love this place! It‚Äôs a hidden gem in Sunset Park, but I recommend this place to everyone. I am not usually a fan of drinks, but their mezcals are so worth trying (they are strong!) The seafood is always so fresh and never disappoints!! Not to mention, the staff are all very friendly :)

Fantastic place all around. Great service, amazing food, especially the empanadas and tacos. We always get the guacamole (spicy) with the sampler platter. It comes with a beer, tostada, empanada, and taco!

Very negative experience. Charged $20 for two tacos that had two slices of avocado and some onions with cabbage (as seen in the picture attached). These were supposed to be Lobster tacos. Do you see any Lobster in those tacos?? Perhaps a microscopic piece that you have to really look for. Very disappointing. I even asked the employee if the Lobster tacos had sufficient Lobster meat in them and he said "absolutely, they are big". Seriously? This is what you call sufficient Lobster meat? I think nonexistent would be a better description. Besides this huge disappointment that left me hungry and feeling ripped off....I was also told that I cannot pay with a credit card, which is very odd for a restaurant, and even more odd because I ordered from this restaurant the day before and paid with a card without any issue. And i expressed that to the employee and he looked at me with confusion and said he has no idea how i paid with a card since they only take cash. Meanwhile they are using a POS system that clearly takes all payment types. Seems like they make up rules as they go. When i clearly expressed frustration amd confusion with these made up rules...he suddendly changed the tune and suddendly said they do accept cards. This was ridiculous and clearly selective service based on customer, as they feel like it. And if all that wasnt horrible enough, I look at the check and realize they charged more than 4% surcharge for using my card. I have been in the payments industry for 20 years and know  very well that it is ILLEGAL to surcharge customers more than 4% for card payments. The law clearly caps the maximum charge to 4%. I expressed that to the employee and the manager (who claimed not to speak English)....and they got very annoyed and instead of apologizing and acknowledging they are conducting business in an ILLEGAL way, they charged me the higher rate regardless. This business is clearly running in a very shady and unethical manner. Not only did they deceive me and not provide adequate food but they are selective in who they allow to pay with cards, and when they do take cards they ILLEGALLY charge a surcharge higher than the law allows. Very frustrating and unpleasant experience.

My friend and I went to check out The King of Fish at 5pm on a Tuesday after seeing the rave reviews. I made a reservation, but it wasn't necessary! I do want to add that it was drizzling, so that could be why the restaurant was not super busy. The ambiance has a nice, cozy feel and they commit to the nautical theme with their outfits! There was a prettier seating area in the back, but it looked like it was under renovation.

I had three tacos: shrimp ($6), fish ($6), and octopus ($7). My friend got the platter sampler ($20). The highlight was the freshness of the seafood. That being said, I do like the taste of fresh shrimp, light fish, and octopus, but find the profiles to be on the mild side. I can appreciate the lightness but prefer a more robust flavor profile playing with sauces, spices, and vegetables in the taco. I also liked that their taco shell was robust enough to not fall apart but maintained the soft-taco vibes. My favorite was the fish because the batter provided more flavor.

Service here was warm and welcoming! Our original server just spoke Spanish, so the bartender stepped in to help us translate. They did multiple check backs to make sure we were okay and did not pressure us with the check. If you're looking for cozy vibes and fresh seafood small bites, then check out The King of Fish!

I was born and raised in Tijuana, Mexico and would frequent Ensenada for fish tacos and mariscos. I can confidently say these fish tacos and tostada as are on par if not better than the ones I‚Äôve had over my lifetime. The tortillas are homemade, which truly elevates the tacos here. Service is also incredible. A truly hidden gem, and my new favorite spot for mariscos!
Good portions. Yummy drinks! Amazing food! Great service! Fun vibes. Happy 5th year anniversary! You deserve it!

Came here right around opening and it was pretty empty. Service was busy and distracted even though I was the only customer at the time. Food itself was pretty good and distinctive - I‚Äôd try more dishes. They only accepted cash/zelle.

Found this place by accident and so glad we did! The food was delicious and fresh! The baby shark empanadas ü§§ü§§ are a must!
Service was great. Will definitely comeback and highly recommend
The king fish was amazing !!! Food was amazing!! Customer service was awesome !!!  Drinks was delicious!!! Food was fresh !!

Outstanding food and two pages of mezcal-based cocktails. Tortillas are made in house and sing oh-so-harmoniously with the sauce, flavor and texture in the best fish taco I have ever tried.
The service is a bit confused, but sweet nonetheless. You may get things you didn‚Äôt order and did not get things you ordered, but anything that lands on your table will leave you mighty impressed.
The highlights are the house guacamole, fish tacos, red snapper in garlic and butter sauce.

Best Fish Tacos!! Wow. The ceviche tostada was also amazing! I tried the jalapeno tuna taco and crab empanada. And of course I had to try the coconut flan everyone is raving about. And YES! Do not leave without trying this! Drinks were fresh, strong and not tart or sour. Felt pretty good after two. Lol. The staff were so attentive and we did not wait long for anything! I wish I knew about this place sooner! It's actually a bit hidden. But now that you know, come and check this spot out. You will not be disappointed.

I couldn‚Äôt recommend this place more‚Äîthe food, ambiance, and drinks were all perfect. We kept the menu after ordering because we knew we would order more (and we did). I would definitely recommend the mixed seafood tostada and fish taco as they were love at first bite and packed with toppings!! We also got "The King of Fish" which is their fried fresh fish served with rice and salad and available only on Sat/Sun‚Äîso glad I got to try this limited dish. They also have an extensive drinks menu which were not too expensive compared to other places. The staff is super accommodating and you can tell they love what they do! Would love to come back when I‚Äôm in the area and try new menu items~
Yesterday was the first time we visited this restaurant. I came because of the good reviews and a strong desire to eat fish. It was incredible and better than expected!‚Ä¶
Amazing Aguachile. Must have dish. Also get the octopus tacos‚Ä¶ they have amazing char. Great atmosphere, live music and awesome service. Will be back
yuuum! great fish taco, lovely staff, nice atmosphere. would deff recommend :) a little pricey but honestly worth the quality/yumminess of the fish!!!

Amazing food! The seafood is always fresh and the dishes are delicious and unique. The freshly made guacamole is one of my favorites. The service is always so friendly and attentive. I've been here several times and they never miss! I definitely recommend this restaurant.

Extremely fun spot. The food is so good (very fresh and flavorful seafood), the vibes are fun, prices are reasonable. We've tried a bunch of things on the menu and especially liked the seafood cocktail and the tacos.
The lobster taco is phenomenal. Edgar pours a mean margarita. Looking forward to exploring more of the menu.

Delicious seafood forward Mexican food, and friendly service. I recommend sitting in the backyard, which is bright and welcoming; indoors it was pretty dark. The aguachile was my favorite because it was so fresh and tasty.

Let me start by saying the ambiance so breath taking , my best friend and I took a seat in the back which was secluded and we had it for over self . Did I mention that it is heated . We started off with the Calamari platter which also came with shrimp and fish . The spicy shrimp taco / crab empanadas was  mouth watering . We washed it down with Pinche Cato which has tequila/ German/ sherry and watermelon. Very flavorful. Let‚Äôs not forget to mention Sebastian the most amazing server thank you for your hospitality.

I think I found an incredible staple to The Sunset park area. The vibe and energy to this place is amazing. The food is absolutely exquisite and tasty. The tacos and drinks are very authentic and original The Owner Roger is a great guy, he greeted my lady and I with the absolute kindness. If you haven‚Äôt been to this beautiful spot you‚Äôre missing out because it‚Äôs most definitely a gem!

Every single dish and drink in this place was amazing. The tostadas sampler and empanadas were delish. Ohh and the drinks are experience to not miss, the uyuyu and the naguare are both mezcal based delish yet strong. Our new favorite neighborhood spot.

I get around New York.  I eat at several restaurants and visit many cocktail bars each month.  Recently I‚Äôve been on a taco tour.

If you read my reviews, you‚Äôll notice I try to rate fairly and as highly as possible as long as it‚Äôs honest.

I want everyone to know that this experience is DIFFERENT.  If I could rate The King of Fish 10 stars, I would.  I texted someone as I sipped my final cocktail of the evening and said, ‚ÄúI‚Äôm sipping this last cocktail as slowly as possible because it‚Äôs just me, the Venezuelan owner, and another patron originally from Chile.  It‚Äôs somehow magical.‚Äù

This really was a magical night.  These are the kind of nights that made me fall in love with New York and has kept me here for the last three years.  This seafood place and bar is so laid back and fun.  They have live entertainment.  Tonight was jazz.

It feels like a community.  The owner made all of my drinks personally, and he‚Äôs one of the nicest and most personable people I‚Äôve ever met.  He made me feel like we had known each other for years.  The servers were attentive and were people so cool I would want them to be my friends.

I came here because another local business owner said he had the best fish tacos of his life here.  And he was right.  The fish is fresh, tender and flaky, and well seasoned.  They were different than any fish taco I‚Äôve ever had.  They were served with three different sauces‚Äîhot, medium, and mild.  I love spice, but I enjoyed all three flavors.  They are big, meaty tacos.  Not tiny.  Three was the perfect number, though the fish was so light and tasty, I could have had more.

The cocktail program here is INSANE.  I spend a lot of time in Manhattan, particularly the lower east side.  And I‚Äôve had some good drinks.  But the drinks in Manhattan are 18 dollars at the very best.  22-23 dollars on average.  And some places charge 30, 40, 50 or more for specialty cocktails.

These cocktails are some of the best, if not THE best, I‚Äôve had in a long time.  I‚Äôm tempted to say they are some of the best I‚Äôve ever had in my life, but I‚Äôm riding so high on the ambiance and feelings of happiness, I may be a little biased.

First, please know they make all of their fruit ingredients fresh.  No cheap substitutes.  Second, their mezcal menu is out of this world.  Third, these cocktails are super duper reasonably priced, most 13-16 dollars.  And for what you‚Äôre getting‚Äîan absolute steal.

I had the chilo (mezcal, pineapple, lemon, tamarindo).  I adored the naguara (mezcal, pisco, smoked pineapple‚Äîliterally‚Äîand aguave).  The naguara was like a magic show, as I watched it be smoked under a bell-housing.

I also had the zicatela (mezcal, grand marnier, pineapple, agave, worm salt).  And finished with the El Uyuyuy (mezcal, guava fruit, hibiscus, st. Germain, lime).

Somehow even the tequila shot and lime wedge at the end was the best I‚Äôve ever had.

Prices are great.  People are amazing.  Fish tacos spectacular.  They have a menu teeming with fantastic fish dishes.  Drinks so good I might go back tomorrow.  If not tomorrow, definitely soon.

The owner told me he‚Äôd spent years crafting this menu, and I believe him.

The owner has also opened another restaurant nearby that I can‚Äôt wait to try.

This is my New York.

The food was DELICIOUS! I wasn‚Äôt sure what to order and the tostadas did not disappoint! The service was fantastic- the staff was so warm and friendly. I will definitely be back next time I‚Äôm in town.

A great tacos place near Sunset Park, Brooklyn.
They have plenty of seafood options (as the name suggests). I had three tacos and they were all very good. The waiter seemed busy but were very attentive and helpful to us.
I believe they are related to The King of Meat on the same street.
Fish tacos and Chile relleno are excellent! Fish was super fresh. My girlfriend loved her fish and shrimp tacos. Coconut flan - homemade by his wife - is a must must have!

Popped into [Bar Restaurant Name] for a midweek bite and a couple of drinks. The vibe was solid ‚Äì dim lighting, decent music in the background (thankfully not too loud), and a good mix of people. It felt relaxed without being dead.

The drinks menu was impressive ‚Äì loads of choice, from local craft beers to decent cocktails. I went for a classic G&T which was well-made, though a bit on the pricey side. Food-wise, it was a bit of a mixed bag. The starters came out quickly and were tasty ‚Äì especially the calamari, which was crisp and not greasy. Mains took a bit longer, and while my burger was juicy and packed with flavour, the chips were underwhelming ‚Äì could‚Äôve been hotter and crispier.
